glsa.title: zlib: Buffer overflow
glsa.synopsis: zlib is vulnerable to a buffer overflow which could potentially lead to execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: zlib is a widely used free and patent unencumbered data compression library.

description.p: zlib improperly handles invalid data streams which could lead to a buffer overflow.

impact.p: By creating a specially crafted compressed data stream, attackers can overwrite data structures for applications that use zlib, resulting in arbitrary code execution or a Denial of Service.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All zlib users should upgrade to the latest version:
